dt: {bc}of, relating to, or constituting the degree of comparison that is expressed in English by the unmodified and uninflected form of an adjective or adverb and denotes no increase or diminution
{bc}relating to or constituting a motion or device that is definite, unyielding, constant, or certain in its action
{bc}active and effective in social or economic function rather than merely maintaining peace and order
{bc}indicating, relating to, or characterized by affirmation, addition, inclusion, or presence rather than negation, withholding, or absence

dt.t: took the {wi}positive{/wi} approach and struck a new deal rather than canceling the contract

dt: {bc}having rendition of light and shade similar in tone to the tones of the original subject
{bc}contributing toward or characterized by increase or progression
{bc}directed or moving toward a source of stimulation
{bc}being, relating to, or charged with electricity of which the proton is the elementary unit and which predominates in a glass body after being rubbed with silk
{bc}having higher electric potential and constituting the part from which the current flows to the external circuit

dt.t: the {wi}positive{/wi} terminal of a discharging storage battery

dt: {bc}being an electron-collecting electrode of an electron tube
{bc}marked by or indicating acceptance, approval, or affirmation
{bc}affirming the presence especially of a condition, substance, or organism suspected to be present
{bc}having a test result indicating the presence especially of a condition, substance, or organism
{bc}converging light rays and forming a real inverted image

pt: {sc}sure{/sc} {sc}certain{/sc} {sc}positive{/sc} {sc}cocksure{/sc} mean having no doubt or uncertainty. {sc}sure{/sc} usually stresses the subjective or intuitive feeling of assurance.

pt.t: felt {it}sure{/it} that I had forgotten something

pt: {sc}certain{/sc} may apply to a basing of a conclusion or conviction on definite grounds or indubitable evidence.

pt.t: police are {it}certain{/it} about the cause of the fire

pt: {sc}positive{/sc} intensifies sureness or certainty and may imply opinionated conviction or forceful expression of it.

pt.t: I'm {it}positive{/it} that's the person I saw

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}positivus{/it}, from {it}positus{/it}, past participle of {it}ponere{/it}
shortdef: formally laid down or imposed : prescribed
